question.text: Which of the following characteristics is incorrect with respect to cockroaches?

options.text: A ring of gastric caeca is present at the junction of midgut and hindgut.
Hypopharynx lies within the cavity enclosed by the mouth parts.
In females, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mn>7</mn><mtext>th </mtext></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mn>9</mn><mtext>th </mtext></msup></math> sterna together form a genital pouch.
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mn>10</mn><mtext>th </mtext></msup></math> abdominal segment in both sexes, bears a pair of anal cerci.

solution.text: At the junction between foregut and midgut, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>6</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math> finger-like tubular structures are present called hepatic caeca or gastric caeca. These hepatic caeca help in the secretion of digestive enzymes and absorption.
